docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES, March 6. -- President Rafael Franco of Paraguay has telegraphed to the Presidents of Argentina, Brazil, Chile, Peru, Uruguay and the United States that Paraguay can not be held responsible if the failure of the neutral mediators to...
docs.lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES, March 6. -- President Rafael Franco of Paraguay has telegraphed to the Presidents of Argentina, Brazil, Chile, Peru, Uruguay and the United States that Paraguay can not be held responsible if the failure of the neutral mediators to recognize the new de facto government of Paraguay allows the time limit for exchanging prisoners to expire on Sunday without their release.
docs.abstract: mediators demand written assurance that Paraguay will observe Chaco agreements; Franco denies responsibility if non-recognition halts exchange of prisoners

headline.main: PARAGUAY'S STATUS BARS PEACE MOVES; Mediators Demand Written Assurance of Observance of Chaco Agreements. FRANCO SENDS A WARNING Denies Responsibility if Non-Recognition Halts Exchange of Prisoners by Tomorrow.

byline.original: Special Cable to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES, March 8. -- Paraguay took formal steps today to put the Chaco peace pacts into effect in a manner that is expected to result in the diplomatic recognition of her de facto government this week.
docs.lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES, March 8. -- Paraguay took formal steps today to put the Chaco peace pacts into effect in a manner that is expected to result in the diplomatic recognition of her de facto government this week.
docs.abstract: Paraguay and Bolivia each free 3 officer prisoners

byline.original: Special Cable to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: After five days of light trading and minor fluctuations last week, Saturday's market on the foreign exchanges was upset upon news of the German occupation of the Rhineland towns. All currencies sustained sharp declines on the possibility that...
docs.lead_paragraph: After five days of light trading and minor fluctuations last week, Saturday's market on the foreign exchanges was upset upon news of the German occupation of the Rhineland towns. All currencies sustained sharp declines on the possibility that Germany's action might presage open conflict.

headline.main: FOREIGN EXCHANGE RATES; WEEK ENDED MARCH 7, 1936.

docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES, March 11. -- The provisional government of Paraguay, headed by Colonel Rafael Franco, has decreed a totalitarian State, declaring the revolutionary party and the State inseparable, suspending all political activity for one year and...
docs.lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES, March 11. -- The provisional government of Paraguay, headed by Colonel Rafael Franco, has decreed a totalitarian State, declaring the revolutionary party and the State inseparable, suspending all political activity for one year and putting all industries under the Minister of the Interior.
docs.abstract: Decree puts all industries under Min of Interior

headline.main: PARAGUAY SETS UP A FASCIST REGIME, FIRST IN AMERICAS; Franco Government, Placed in Power by Army, Decrees a Totalitarian State. PARTY HELD ONE WITH IT Political Activity Suspended for Year -- Industry Put Under Interior Minister. PARAGUAY SETS UP A FASCIST REGIME

docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES, March 12.-- Argentina's once famous heavy-weight boxer, Luis Angel Firpo, was acquitted today of complicity in a fraudulent real estate transaction for which he was indicted several years ago. In his prime Firpo, known as the "Wild Bull...
docs.lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES, March 12.-- Argentina's once famous heavy-weight boxer, Luis Angel Firpo, was acquitted today of complicity in a fraudulent real estate transaction for which he was indicted several years ago. In his prime Firpo, known as the "Wild Bull of the Pampas," knocked Jack Dempsey out of the ring in a match for the heavyweight title of the world.
docs.abstract: Cleared of real estate fraud charge, Buenos Aires

headline.main: LUIS FIRPO CLEARED OF A REALTY FRAUD; Ex-Boxer Acquitted in Buenos Aires of Charge That Caused Him to Flee Country.

byline.original: Special Cable to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, March 12. -- The Kingdom of Yugoslavia applied today for permanent registration of $14,875,000 of forty-year 8 per cent external gold bonds due in 1962 and $28,929,000 of 7 per cent secured external gold bonds, Series B, due in 1962, on...
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, March 12. -- The Kingdom of Yugoslavia applied today for permanent registration of $14,875,000 of forty-year 8 per cent external gold bonds due in 1962 and $28,929,000 of 7 per cent secured external gold bonds, Series B, due in 1962, on the New York Stock Exchange, bringing the total of foreign governments which have made such applications to twenty-five.
docs.abstract: Applies to SEC for permanent registration of bonds on N Y Stock Exch

headline.main: YUGOSLAVIA LISTS BONDS WITH SEC; Permanent Registration Asked for $14,875,000 of 8s and $28,929,000 of 7s.

docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES, March 14. -- The government and the people united this afternoon in extending a triumphant welcome to Argentina's first Cardinal. Santiago Luis, Cardinal Copello, Primate of Argentina, Archbishop of Buenos Aires, received from the...
docs.lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES, March 14. -- The government and the people united this afternoon in extending a triumphant welcome to Argentina's first Cardinal. Santiago Luis, Cardinal Copello, Primate of Argentina, Archbishop of Buenos Aires, received from the government all the official pomp and military honors usually reserved for visiting heads of States.
docs.abstract: With Cabinet, Sup Ct, prominent Congressmen and others, welcomes Card Copello to Argentina

headline.main: ARGENTINA GREETS ITS FIRST CARDINAL; Triumphant Welcome Extended to Prelate Who Started Life as Poor Farm Boy.
